Dialogue.NPCText:
You find a sly-eyed woman draped in colorful garb, a tribal mask half-hiding her grin. She twirls a coin between nimble fingers, voice lilting in a sing-song riddle:

“Stranger from forest or foreign sand,
Do you seek truth, trade… or a trick at my hand?”

Her eyes glint, studying your every twitch.

Option.text: Are you Vura Twin-Tongue, the tribe’s trader?
What do you trade in these woods?
I only wish to pass by.

Dialogue.NPCText:
The mask dips, and her smile widens.

“Vura, yes—called Twin-Tongue by friend and foe alike. I spin bargains with Buccaneers, parley with Hinokami, and never say the same thing twice. Or do I?”
“But who are you, wanderer? A hand of mercy, a knife for hire, or merely hungry for secrets?”

Option.text: I hear you have a price on your head.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“All things worth carrying, all things worth hiding—herbs to make you dream, poisons to make you forget, tokens carved from bone and gold.
Some things for coin, some for secrets, some only for a smile. But beware—sometimes the thing you *don’t* buy is the greatest bargain.”
Her fingers tap a coded rhythm on the hilt of a hidden dagger.

Option.text: I heard you crossed Buccaneers and Hinokami.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“The curious are welcome, but the dull are doomed. Watch where you walk, and beware the roots—they trip the careless, and feed the clever.”
She gestures you onward, mask inscrutable.

Option.text: You seem wary. What’s troubling you?
I’ll leave you to your dealings.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Vura laughs softly, a musical sound.

“All pass, all part, all return in time. If you seek stories, bargains, or danger, look for the mask with two tongues.”

“Special? Oh, I have poisonberries from the haunted groves, runestones carved by Verdant shamans, and an amulet that will make your lies sound sweeter.”
She winks. “But which would you dare take—and at what price?”

Option.text: The amulet of lies sounds useful.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She drops a handful of dark berries into your palm, her gaze unreadable.
“Handle with care. Eat with caution. Gift with mischief.”

The runestone is warm, pulsing faintly.
“For luck, for love, for passage unseen. Use it well, or not at all.”

She fastens a twisted pendant around your neck.
“Speak, and the world will want to believe you… at least for a while.”

Vura’s voice lowers.
“Here’s a trick: The truth is a dance, the lie a song. Step wrongly and you’ll trip on both. Ask me what you will, but every answer comes with a price.”

Option.text: Let’s talk about your troubles instead.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Perhaps a secret, perhaps a favor owed. Or perhaps…”
She leans close, eyes glittering.
“A promise you don’t yet know you’ve made. Pay now, pay later—the deal is done.”

Option.text: You really do speak in riddles.
Let’s talk about danger. Are you in trouble?

Dialogue.NPCText:
The mask’s smile sharpens.
“Twin trades, twin debts. Buccaneers want their cut, Hinokami their silence. Now, a knife waits in every shadow. Help me, and I’ll owe you more than coin. Betray me, and perhaps a mask will hide your face next.”

Option.text: How can I help you with the assassins?
Maybe I should turn you in for a reward.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Simple: Find who’s sent the knives—Buccaneer, samurai, or a third shadow? Protect me until midnight’s moon, or bring proof of my end to my rivals. My fate, your fortune.”

Will you guard the liar, or profit from betrayal?

Option.text: I’ll protect you until the danger passes.
Who do you suspect sent the killers?

Dialogue.NPCText:
She inclines her head, genuinely grateful—for once.
“Trust is the rarest coin. Guard me, and the tribe will whisper your name with respect… and maybe fear.”
“All have reason. Buccaneers say I hid gold; Hinokami think I whispered secrets. Or perhaps… it is Minax, who likes the taste of chaos. Follow the trail: look for the mark of a twin serpent.”
“Good. The first clue waits near the twisted willow by the river’s bend. But beware—some riddles bite.”

Vura’s laughter is cold, hollow.
“So, you show your true mask. Find proof of my dealings and take it to the Hinokami or the Buccaneers—see what reward you get. But beware, many who trade in betrayal find their own shadow grows teeth.”

Option.text: How do I prove your guilt?
On second thought, maybe we can work together.
I don’t want to get involved.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Seek the hidden ledger, buried beneath the stone owl outside my tent. Bring it to those who hunt me, and they’ll pay—at least for a little while. Remember, a secret’s value is measured by the cost of silence.”

Option.text: I want no part of this.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Trust no one. And if you take my secret, guard your own. The tribes remember those who profit from betrayal.”
“You shouldn’t. Not fully. Not ever. But even liars keep their promises—when their life depends on it.”

Option.text: All right. How do I help you?
That’s all I needed to know.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Vura tips her mask, eyes glinting with amusement.
“My story? It’s a river that twists, a vine that climbs. I was born beneath thunder, raised among roots and whispers. Learned to lie before I learned to walk. But every tale is true—if you want it enough.”

“What do you wish to know, wanderer? My past, my passions… or my secrets?”

Option.text: How did you become the tribe's trader?
Why do you lie so much?

Dialogue.NPCText: “Trade is survival, here or anywhere. My mother bartered stories for bread, my father swapped courage for coin. When the storms came, I became a bridge—between Verdant, pirates, strangers. I learned the price of everything, and the value of nothing—except freedom.”

Option.text: And now you trade with Buccaneers and Hinokami?
Tell me something you won't trade.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She hesitates, mask tilting.
“Trust? Like rain—rare, and gone before you taste it. But sometimes, a bargain is struck on faith alone. Maybe you and I will find out, yes?”

“Of course! I speak the tongue of every tribe—sometimes two at once. Pirates crave chaos, Hinokami respect order. I bring them what they desire, and take what they do not see. That's the trick: know the market, know the heart.”

Option.text: What does your own heart desire?

Dialogue.NPCText:
She grins, softer now.
“I love riddles, wild places, and storms that break the silence. The laughter of children. The thrill when a plan unfolds—especially if it surprises even me.”
“But above all, I love to win a game that everyone else thinks is unwinnable.”

Option.text: What game are you playing now?
That’s all I wanted to know.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Survival is always the first game. But perhaps now, I play for more: for the tribe, for a future beyond war, for a mask that does not need to hide. Or maybe I just want to see who dares play with me.”

Option.text: I’ll play, if the prize is right.
Option.action: SendMessage:She laughs—a genuine sound, for once.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Storms don’t lie. They roar and break, and leave the air clean. When thunder shakes the world, even the oldest secrets crawl out to dance in the rain.”

Option.text: Are you hiding any secrets from me?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Vura’s eyes glimmer behind her mask.
“Truth is brittle; lies bend and flow. Each lie I tell is a shield, a test, a gift, or a trap. Sometimes a lie is the only kindness I have left.”

Option.text: Has a lie ever cost you dearly?

Dialogue.NPCText:
She leans close.
“Only once, when it truly matters. And that moment is never what you expect.”

Option.text: Would you be honest with me?

Dialogue.NPCText:
For a moment, her mask slips. There’s pain there.
“Regret is the shadow cast by every step. I regret the friend I betrayed to save myself. I regret bargains made for safety, when I could have chosen bravery.”

Option.text: You can still make things right.
Is that why you help the tribe?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Perhaps. Or perhaps I just hope my story ends better than it began.”
She offers you a small token, pressing it into your palm.
She studies you, considering.

Vura’s voice drops to a whisper.
“I have a brother among the Hinokami—he thinks me dead. If you ever find a samurai with eyes like mine, tell him: ‘Vura remembers the moonlit pond.’ Only then will he know you speak truth.”

Option.text: That’s a powerful secret. I’ll remember it.
Can you trust me with more?

Dialogue.NPCText:
She chuckles, shaking her head.
“Trust is hard-earned, shadow-walker. Here’s a riddle instead:
‘I speak without a tongue, run without legs, and can be trusted by none. What am I?’”
“Clever, but not quite. Try again another day.”
